title: Kylian Mbappe to miss PSG's clash with Angers as he suffers ANOTHER injury set-back
text:
Kylian Mbappe will be sidelined for Paris Saint Germain's Ligue 1 clash against Angers as the striker's start to the new season faces another setback.

The World Cup winner's has been out for more than a month after sustaining a hamstring problem in August when the French champions played Toulouse.

The 20-year-old made a return last week when he set up fellow superstar Neymar in PSG's win over Bordeaux, and came off the bench on Tuesday during the Champions League win against Galatasaray.

Kylian Mbappe will miss his side's top of the table clash with Angers this weekend

The 20-year-old has had a hamstring problem but returned against Bordeaux last week

However, Mbappe won't feature as the Ligue 1 leaders face second placed Angers on Saturday afternoon.

'It's not possible for him to be with us tomorrow,' head coach Thomas Tuchel said. 'But he's not suffered a relapse. It's a reaction between the scar and the nerve. I understand that it'll take a bit of time to treat the scar.

'He felt very free but now there's been a small reaction. When he feels that, he is not loose. I'm convinced that after a few days of treatment, he will be totally ready, as was the case before Bordeaux.

Mbappe joins Edinson Cavani on the sidelines as the pair look to shake off injuries

'He's shown that he's capable of doing a lot of accelerations and sprints without feeling anything.'

PSG, who are inundated with plenty of attacking options, are also without Edinson Cavani, who was scheduled to return before Mbappe but remains sidelined.

Tuchel said: 'I don't know, we'll have to wait until training. He trained on Thursday. He trained after Bordeaux but he told me he didn't feel 100%.

'Thilo Kehrer, Julian Draxer and Colin Dagba, they are not with the team.

'Thomas Meunier had treatment yesterday and will do a complete training session today, and we'll see after. He's played a lot and has small muscle pains in his thigh.'
description: The 20-year-old made a return last week when he set up fellow superstar Neymar in PSG's win over Bordeaux, and came off the bench on Tuesday during their Champions League win on Tuesday.
